passage: Socrates was a philosopher who spent much of his life in Athens, Greece, teaching others the art of dialectic. He believed that personal inquiry and discussion were the best ways to reach the truth. As a result, he often engaged in conversations where he would question people's beliefs and challenge their assumptions. Although he never wrote any of his teachings down, his ideas have had a lasting impact on Western philosophy, primarily through the works of his student, Plato.
question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

choices.A: Socrates was mostly known for his teaching method of dialectic and his engagement in challenging conversations.
choices.B: Socrates was a philosopher who lived in Athens and never wrote any of his teachings down.
choices.C: Socrates focused on personal inquiry and discussion to pursue truth and had a lasting impact on Western philosophy.
choices.D: Socrates' influence on Western philosophy can be attributed to the fact that his student Plato documented his ideas.

explanation: C: 'Socrates focused on personal inquiry and discussion to pursue truth and had a lasting impact on Western philosophy.' is the correct answer because it encompasses Socrates' approach to philosophy and his lasting impact on Western thought.
distractor_explanation: 'Socrates was a philosopher who lived in Athens and never wrote any of his teachings down.' is incorrect because it only provides basic information about Socrates and does not capture the main idea of the text.

'Socrates was mostly known for his teaching method of dialectic and his engagement in challenging conversations.' is incorrect because it focuses on Socrates' teaching method but does not mention his lasting impact on Western philosophy.

'Socrates' influence on Western philosophy can be attributed to the fact that his student Plato documented his ideas.' is incorrect because it only explains how Socrates' ideas were preserved and does not emphasize his overall contributions to Western thought.
